channel.title: Cache downloader bull
channel.description:
So I think that either my cache downloader is very finniky, or I'm doing something wrong in the process. I recently changed my cache downloader link, to a link provided by dropbox. It worked fine. I then proceded to edit the cache, then as I try to upload the cache and download it via the client, I get the error:
[code]java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\DreamscapeV14\Maps\mapConfig.txt (The system c annot find the path specified) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileReader.<init>(Unknown Source) at client.setNewMaps(client.java:524) at client.startUp(client.java:8001) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:5407) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) [/code]
or this when I delete my cache from my c: drive.
[code] java.io.FileNotFoundException: https://dl.dropbox.com/u/45679064/DreamscapeV14.z ip at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(Unknown So urce) at sun.net.www.protocol.https.HttpsURLConnectionImpl.getInputStream(Unkn own Source) at CacheDownloader.downloadFile(CacheDownloader.java:105) at CacheDownloader.downloadCache(CacheDownloader.java:75) at client.startUp(client.java:8000) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:5407) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\DreamscapeV14\Maps\mapConfig.txt (The system c annot find the path specified) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileReader.<init>(Unknown Source) at client.setNewMaps(client.java:524) at client.startUp(client.java:8001) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:5407) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) [/code]
What is causing this to happen at certain times, and not at other times. I HAVE MY MAPS CONFIG IN THE RIGHT PLACE, so that is not the case.

item.title: Cache downloader bull
item.dc:creator: @I_am_beast I am beast
item.description:
@I_am_beast wrote:

So I think that either my cache downloader is very finniky, or Iâ€™m doing something wrong in the process. I recently changed my cache downloader link, to a link provided by dropbox. It worked fine. I then proceded to edit the cache, then as I try to upload the cache and download it via the client, I get the error:

java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\DreamscapeV14\Maps\mapConfig.txt (The system c annot find the path specified) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileReader.<init>(Unknown Source) at client.setNewMaps(client.java:524) at client.startUp(client.java:8001) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:5407) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
